subject: Law
title: Miranda v. Arizona
description: Learn Miranda v. Arizona in one minute.

hook.text: 'You have the right to remain silent.' Every arrest in America starts with these words. One case made it so.

buildup.text: Miranda v. Arizona (1966) required police to inform suspects of their rights before custodial interrogation.

discovery.text: The rights: remain silent, statements can be used against you, right to an attorney, and a free one if needed.

twist.text: Ernesto Miranda was retried without his confession, convicted again, and later killed in a bar fight.

climax.text: Miranda rights are so embedded in culture that even children know them from TV shows.

punchline.text: Silence is a right. The police must tell you that first.

quiz.question: What did Miranda v. Arizona require?
options: Police to inform suspects of their rights
